name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Amid continued concerns about the coronavirus surge in Alameda County, Piedmont officials close access to Linda Beach play area until further notice, saying people continued to play group sports at the site despite repeated warnings. https://t.co/vST7FLQIoz

text: California and New York have taken very different paths during the coronavirus pandemic, with vastly different outcomes. @ErinAllDay explains how their strategies and results played out: https://t.co/GtXe4Z8qkk https://t.co/NrTWYXnvsR

text: Google to allow most employees to work from home through June 2021. name: sfchronicle
text: A deadly coronavirus outbreak looked inevitable in March for Laguna Honda, the largest nursing home in the state. Residents felt scared. Workers were frightened too. But no residents or workers have died of COVID-19. Here's how they did it. https://t.co/Bz8brXfn9s

name: sfchronicle
text: National Security Adviser Robert O‚ÄôBrien has tested positive for the coronavirus, according to a Monday statement from the White House. He is experiencing ‚Äúmild symptoms‚Äù and is ‚Äúself-isolating in a remote location,‚Äù officials said in a statement. https://t.co/cn71xnWDfc https://t.co/WoQShmlRHP

name: sfchronicle
text: By the time New York shut down, a large portion of the population in New York City was already infected, public health experts now believe. https://t.co/lnOEIuavlB

text: Google will allow most employees to work from home through June 2021 as coronavirus infections surge, keeping one of biggest workforces in tech and the Bay Area away from the office. https://t.co/PScknTlNRh https://t.co/awTBDUrPf1

name: sfchronicle
text: Officials in Vietnam announced Monday that they will evacuate 80,000 people from the resort town of Da Nang after three people tested positive, according to a CNN report.
